summary: An email exchange between Assistant U.S. Attorneys discussing case management pressures, specifically mentioning the Epstein case. The sender notes their team is receiving near-daily prodding about deadlines for memos related to the Epstein case, describing the work as extremely time-intensive.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email inquiring about pressure from chiefs on written work product, specifically mentioning the Epstein case.

events.title: Email discussion of Epstein case pressure
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails colleagues asking if their teams are experiencing significant pressure from chiefs on memos or written product, specifically citing the Epstein case where they are getting near-daily prodding about imminent deadlines for time-intensive memos.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The Epstein case was generating significant internal pressure within the U.S. Attorney's office as of April 2020.
Prosecutors working on the Epstein case were receiving near-daily prodding from chiefs about deadlines for memos.
The work product required for the Epstein case was described as extremely time-intensive.
The email suggests the pressure might have been isolated to the Epstein case rather than a broader trend in the unit.
